channel.title: CVE Feed for F5 Networks, Inc. -- BIG-IP LTM, AAM, AFM, Analytics, APM, ASM, DNS, GTM, Link Controller, PEM, Websafe
channel.description: The latest CVEs for F5 Networks, Inc. -- BIG-IP LTM, AAM, AFM, Analytics, APM, ASM, DNS, GTM, Link Controller, PEM, Websafe

item.title: CVE-2017-6138|2024-09-17T02:21:41.401Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20ltm%2C%20aam%2C%20afm%2C%20analytics%2C%20apm%2C%20asm%2C%20dns%2C%20gtm%2C%20link%20controller%2C%20pem%2C%20websafe
item.description: In F5 BIG-IP LTM, AAM, AFM, Analytics, APM, ASM, DNS, GTM, Link Controller, PEM and WebSafe software version 13.0.0 and 12.1.0 - 12.1.2, malicious requests made to virtual servers with an HTTP profile can cause the TMM to restart. The issue is exposed with BIG-IP APM profiles, regardless of settings. The issue is also exposed with the non-default "normalize URI" configuration options used in iRules and/or BIG-IP LTM policies.

item.title: CVE-2017-6159|2024-09-17T02:46:34.159Z -- f5%20networks%2C%20inc. -- big-ip%20ltm%2C%20aam%2C%20afm%2C%20analytics%2C%20apm%2C%20asm%2C%20dns%2C%20gtm%2C%20link%20controller%2C%20pem%2C%20websafe
item.description: F5 BIG-IP LTM, AAM, AFM, Analytics, APM, ASM, DNS, GTM, Link Controller, PEM, Websafe software version 12.0.0 to 12.1.2, 11.6.0 to 11.6.1 are vulnerable to a denial of service attack when the MPTCP option is enabled on a virtual server. Data plane is vulnerable when using the MPTCP option of a TCP profile. There is no control plane exposure. An attacker may be able to disrupt services by causing TMM to restart hence temporarily failing to process traffic.
